description: {"blocks":[{"key":"66bkh","text":"This protocol is used in our Laboratory in Liverpool to perform IF on Bodo saltans cells. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

funders.funder_name: Gordon and Betty Moore Foundation’s Symbiosis in Aquatic Systems Initiative

status.info: We use this protocol and it’s working.

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"7t5oe","text":"Bodo saltans was cultured in a cerophyl-based medium enriched with 3.5 mM sodium phosphate dibasic (Na2HPO4)1. Cultures were incubated at 22 °C in T25 tissue culture flasks containing 20 ml of media bacterized with Klebsiella pneumoniae subsp. Pneumoniae (ATCC® 700831). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":12},{"style":"italic","offset":215,"length":39},{"style":"sub","offset":102,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":106,"length":1},{"style":"sup","offset":108,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"e0q0q","text":"Please, follow the steps below to prepare cells for immunostaining.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f59ip","text":"Harvest the cells by centrifugation at 1200 × g for 12 mins at 19 °C.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"118lu","text":"Wash the cells with PBS and centrifuge as described above. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fut4g","text":"Dissolve the pellet in 15 µl of PBS and mix with the same volume of low melting temperature agarose (eg. Thermo Fisher Scientific) in a single well of a 96-well plate. Let it ser for a few seconds.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ck5j7","text":"Add 200 µl of 4% PFA and incubate at room temperature for 10 minutes or at 4 °C overnight.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"35kou","text":"Wash with PTX (PBS + 0,1% TritonX) 4 times, 30 mins each wash.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6215u","text":"Incubate with primary antibody (1:100, diluted in PTX + 5% FBS), for 5 hours at room temperature or overnight at 4 °C. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"2ggs2","text":"Rinse and wash 3 times for 1 hour with PTX at room temperature. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3853h","text":"Incubate with secondary antibody (1:1000, diluted in PTX + 5% FBS) overnight at 4°C.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"45g28","text":"Rinse and wash 3 times for 1 hour with PTX at room temperature. During 2nd wash add Hoechest 33342 (Thermo Fisher, 1:2000) for 10 minutes. This will be rinsed away with the 3rd wash.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":72,"length":2},{"style":"sup","offset":174,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f5945","text":"Remove the agarose from the well with clean forceps and place it on a microscope slide. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b7b9","text":"Add a drop of a mounting medium (eg. Vectashield, Vector Laboratories), and flatten the agarose as much as you can using the coverslip. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5jkpl","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"969fc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"0F93C950CAF311ECAC187BDD8A28B54E","height":149,"id":236024,"is_video":false,"legend":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":12,"offset":42,"style":"italic"},{"length":4,"offset":228,"style":"italic"}],"key":"bshcc","text":"Figure 1: Confocal image of a single fixedBodo saltans stained with beta-tubulin antibody (clone KMX-1, gift from Dr. Jack Sunter (Oxford Brooks) and Prof. Keith Gull (Oxford University)). A) Beta-tubulin. B) DNA of the same of Bodo cell (nucleus, kinetoplast and intracellular bacteria) stained with Hoechst 33342 . C) Overlay of the two channels.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}},"mime":"image/png","original_name":"Bodo tubulin.png","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/hgr4bihbp.jpg","source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/hgr2bihbp.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/hgr3bihbp.webp","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/hgrzbihbp.webp","width":550}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2jvpf","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"ftho7","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"258A3140CAF311ECAC187BDD8A28B54E","height":154.00000000000003,"id":236028,"is_video":false,"legend":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":4,"offset":43,"style":"italic"},{"length":4,"offset":162,"style":"italic"}],"key":"ei7h6","text":"Figure 2: Confocal image of a single fixed Bodo cell stained with beta-actin antibody (clone D6A8, Cell Signalling Technology). A) Beta-actin. B) DNA the same of Bodo cell (nucleus, kinetoplast and intracellular bacteria) stained with Hoechst 33342 C) Overlay of two channels.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}},"mime":"image/png","original_name":"Bodo Actin.png","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/hgr8bihbp.jpg","source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/hgr6bihbp.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/hgr7bihbp.webp","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/hgr5bihbp.webp","width":219.80813953488382}}}}

title: Immunostaining of Bodo saltans
